A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Disguised as a family friendly follow up to The Force Awakens\, Rian Johnson’s 105 minute epic perhaps delivers the most viscerally stunning and compelling installment to the cannon yet. Along with gut-wrenching action\, The Last Jedi exposes the flaws and strengths of every character\, to a point where every pre-existing notion of is challenged. Some may say it’s too long\, they may say it’s humor is misplaced\, but the truth is Rian Johnson’s magnum opus is full of hyper meta layers with much more allegory than silliness. This movie isn’t just about Star Wars\, it’s about morality\, purpose and so keenly put\, hubris. It won’t leave you with the nostalgic feels of it’s predecessor\, but rather challenge you and your cinematic eye as it truly encompasses the meaning of an ‘epic’.
